identificationModule.briefTitle: Intracranial Neurophysiological Signatures of Fear and Anxiety in Humans
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intracranial Neurophysiological Signatures of Fear and Anxiety in Humans

collaborators.name: VA Greater Los Angeles Healthcare System

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
Anxiety disorders such as post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) affect a large number of individuals with a significant portion of patients failing to improve with current treatments.

The purpose of this study is to understand the brain mechanisms that produce fear and anxiety in humans. To accomplish this goal, we will measure the brain activity along with the heart rate and skin perspiration of patients while they are completing tasks on a computer. Some of the tasks will also use a virtual reality headset and transport the patient in a video game-like environment. These tasks will expose the participants to various levels of fear-provoking images.

interventions.name: Deep Brain Stimulation
interventions.description: Deep brain stimulation will be used

primaryOutcomes.description: Eye blinks will be measured using an eye tracking device and will be measure in blinks per second.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the intervention/behavioral tasks with and without stimulation

primaryOutcomes.description: heart rate variability will be measured in milliseconds.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the intervention/behavioral tasks with and without stimulation

primaryOutcomes.description: Skin conductance will be measured in microSiemens.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the intervention/behavioral tasks with and without stimulation

primaryOutcomes.description: Neurophysiological activity will be measured in Hz
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: during the intervention/behavioral tasks with and without stimulation

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18 years of age or older
* Has undergone acute depth or chronic responsive neurostimulation (RNS) electrode placement
* Willing to provide informed consent and participate in the study
* Ability to read and write English fluently

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unwilling to provide informed consent
* Not a native English Speaker
* Has not undergone acute depth or chronic responsive neurostimulation (RNS) electrode placement
* Pregnant women
* Participants with active psychosis
* Participants with suicidal ideation
* Participants with substance abuse issues

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: The data collected for this research represent a valuable resource to the scientific community, and the PIs will make them accessible to others, while respecting the special needs for confidentiality. All data will be anonymized before being provided to the scientific community. Researchers can also request access to the data under collaborative and co-authorship agreements
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: All data will be provided by the time publication occurs or when the proposed funding period has ended.
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Researchers can request access to the data under collaborative and coauthorship agreements prior to the end of the funding period or before publication.
